The subtext of your article reads: Low self-esteem; don't feel you're worth looking after your own health and avoiding becoming a burden to your family and society as you age; bemoan those who do care, as a defence mechanism; reinforce defence mechanism further by inviting others' to reinforce their own sense of inertia and apathy to normalise it; get paid for that luxury. Do these papers just have money to burn? How about getting a health psychologist to write articles instead?

Yeah, when he """"writes"""" a book or op-ed piece, I just wonder, who was the ghostwriter, since you can tell his vocab level by his speaking and tweeting. Campaigning in PA, they gave him a 9 sentence statement to read from a teleprompter, and it took him 45 minutes to get through it, because he kept going off script. The inauguration speech should be a blast.
